title: Mining a Minimal Set of Behavioral Patterns using Incremental Evaluation
abstract: Process mining provides methods to analyse event logs generated by information systems during the execution of processes. It thereby supports the design, validation, and execution of processes in domains ranging from healthcare, through manufacturing, to e-commerce. To explore the regularities of flexible processes that show a large behavioral variability, it was suggested to mine recurrent behavioral patterns that jointly describe the underlying process. Existing approaches to behavioral pattern mining, however, suffer from two limitations. First, they show limited scalability as incremental computation is incorporated only in the generation of pattern candidates, but not in the evaluation of their quality. Second, process analysis based on mined patterns shows limited effectiveness due to an overwhelmingly large number of patterns obtained in practical application scenarios, many of which are redundant. translated_title: 使用增量评估挖掘最小的行为模式集合的方法
translated_abstract: 过程挖掘提供了分析信息系统在执行过程中生成的事件日志的方法。它支持从医疗保健、制造业到电子商务等领域的过程设计、验证和执行。为了探索具有大量行为可变性的灵活流程的规律性，建议挖掘共同描述底层流程的重复行为模式。然而，现有的行为模式挖掘方法存在两个限制。首先，它们在生成模式候选人时只采用了增量计算，但在评估其质量时却没有使用增量计算，因此可扩展性有限。其次，基于挖掘模式的过程分析在实际应用场景中获得了大量冗余模式，导致效果有限。在本文中，我们解决了这些限制，以便更好地分析复杂过程。
tldr: 本论文介绍了一种使用增量评估挖掘最小的行为模式集合的方法，以解决现有方法的可扩展性和实际应用中冗余模式的问题。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a method for mining a minimal set of behavioral patterns using incremental evaluation, addressing the limitations of existing approaches in terms of scalability and redundant patterns in practical applications.
